cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River (or 325 mi SE of Houma, Louisiana)
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico and on course to strike the southeast-central Louisiana coast, then turning north and northeast over western Mississippi early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near Houma / the Mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA; Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of Pearl River; Storm-surge warnings eastward to AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Louisiana coast from Intracoastal City eastward to Mouth of Pearl River (hurricane) and Cameron to Intracoastal City (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama Gulf coasts
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands could bring occasional gusts 25–35 mph (low, 18 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of less than 1 ft expected along the upper Texas coast; highest values (1–3 ft) stay east of Sabine Pass
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible, generally 1–2 inches; widespread heavy rain remains well east of Galveston
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches
